item.title: Birds Of A Feather: Postmortem
item.description: The last we saw of her that night, was the nurses working overtime, shooting me their side-eyed stared, as they were pulling out the glass There was a bottle on the ground, that was shattered long before, and the splinters stuck around, just waiting for the gore. item.title: Death Is The Cost Of Living
item.description: There was something in her voice when it washed over me, my ears would stop, and filter out the noise. It’d been a while since I’d been by, and I can’t say that I’m happy, but I can say that I’m proud. There was something in eyes when it locked with mine, that killed me slow, but it made me feel alive.
